testcase.name: Broken ID locator
testcase.classname: RTCtek - Demonstrate failing locators across strategies
testcase.system-out: @rtctek @bad_id Scenario: Broken ID locator # src/test/resources/features/rtctek_locators.feature:12 âœ… RTC Smart Driver HTTP integration initialized ðŸ”§ RTC WebDriver wrapper initialized with automatic healing Given I open the RTCtek homepage # com.example.steps.LocatorSteps.i_open_the_rtctek_homepage() ðŸ”§ Locator failed, attempting RTC healing: By.id: menu-main-men âœ… Locator healed: By.id: menu-main-men â†’ menu-main-menu âœ… Successfully located: id = menu-main-men ðŸ”§ Element found: ul When I try to locate by "id" with value "menu-main-men" # com.example.steps.LocatorSteps.i_try_to_locate_by_with_value(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Then the step should fail due to locator issue # com.example.steps.LocatorSteps.the_step_should_fail_due_to_locator_issue()
testcase.system-err: Sep 10, 2025 4:10:33 PM org.openqa.selenium.devtools.CdpVersionFinder findNearestMatch WARNING: Unable to find CDP implementation matching 140 Sep 10, 2025 4:10:33 PM org.openqa.selenium.chromium.ChromiumDriver lambda$new$5 WARNING: Unable to find version of CDP to use for 140.0.7339.81. You may need to include a dependency on a specific version of the CDP using something similar to `org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-devtools-v86:4.21.0` where the version ("v86") matches the version of the chromium-based browser you're using and the version number of the artifact is the same as Selenium's.

testcase.name: Broken XPATH - wrong id
testcase.classname: RTCtek - Demonstrate failing locators across strategies
testcase.system-out: @rtctek @bad_xpath_1 Scenario: Broken XPATH - wrong id # src/test/resources/features/rtctek_locators.feature:37 Given I open the RTCtek homepage # com.example.steps.LocatorSteps.i_open_the_rtctek_homepage() ðŸ”§ Locator failed, attempting RTC healing: By.xpath: //*[@id='menu-item-4711']/a âœ… Locator healed: By.xpath: //*[@id='menu-item-4711']/a â†’ //a[text()='About Us'] âœ… Successfully located: xpath = //*[@id='menu-item-4711']/a ðŸ”§ Element found: a When I try to locate by "xpath" with value "//*[@id='menu-item-4711']/a" # com.example.steps.LocatorSteps.i_try_to_locate_by_with_value(java.lang.String,java.lang.String) Then the step should fail due to locator issue # com.example.steps.LocatorSteps.the_step_should_fail_due_to_locator_issue()
